title: 100bitcoin
author: 100bitcoin
created_time: September 01, 2022, 01:40:21 PMLast edit: October 27, 2022, 03:36:03 PM by 100bitcoin
content: Lately, after the painful demise of http://preev.com, I saw a lot of discussion on BitcoinTalk mentioning https://100bit.co.in. This is primarily why I am creating this thread. 100 Bitcoin currently works as a simple BTC/Sats to FIAT converter and provides Bitcoin price on current date for 10 years (including current year). Following currencies are supported...Australian Dollar - AUDCanadian Dollar- CADChinese Yuan- CNYEuro - EURGreat Britain Pound- GBPIndian Rupee - INRJapanese Yen - JPYSouth Korean Won - KRWRussian Ruble - RUBUnited States Dollar - USDIf any of you have some feature in mind, that you would like to see on 100 Bitcoin, please do mention it below. Feel free to wear our signature to promote this free service on BitcoinTalk. Code:[center][size=21pt][b][url=https://100bit.co.in][color=red]100bit.co.in [/color][color=black]|[/color][color=blue] Live BTC Price [/color][color=black]|[/color][color=green] 10 Year's Chart [/color][/url] [color=black]|[/color] [url=https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5412015.0][color=orange] BitcoinTalk[/color][/url][/b][/size][/center]You may also like to follow us on Twitter & Facebook. A few words on social media regarding this project would immensely help it to grow.

About the price history.In a 24hours cycle of a day bitcoin price moves. It can not be a fixed X. So you might need to get the time of the day too or may be need to mention that it's the H or L of the day. Keep it very simple like Preev.comThe preev site got popularity because of the simplicity.

Clicking over or below the box doesn't work however. 100bit.co.in and preev.net are two identical sites design-wise. Both show the same BTC values at the same time because both fetch their data from CoinGecko. 100bit has that historical price reference, but everything else is about the same. Which site came first?
